"External frame" Widget
The "External frame" Widget
is a tool that allows displaying other Systems in the object profile (by the given URL).
Example of a configured widget:
Adding a widget is done in the
visual editing mode
. When switching to the Widgets tab in the Elements panel, drag (Drag&drop) the "External frame" widget into the profile area (into the previously added "Row" space container).
The “Frame to external system” widget can only be dragged and dropped into the “Row” space container previously added to the profile workspace from the “Groupings” tab of the “Elements” panel.
The system will display the widget settings.
Widget settings
Setting
Purpose
Algorithm for external system link
Adding an algorithm that returns a link to an external system. The selection is made using a drop-down list of pre-created algorithms. To create a new algorithm, click on the kebab menu on the right side of the field and select "Add" in the context menu.
The algorithm should return a
text
with a link to an external system.
Widget height, px
Specifying the widget height in px by entering a numeric value.
The default value is 150.
The URL that displays the external system is displayed should not have restrictions, read more
here
.
Once the widget is set up, the visual will display a frame to an external system.
Use example
The
www.paylab.com/salary-calculators-list
site should be displayed in the object profile.
To do this, in the visual editing mode, add the "Row" element to the workspace, and then the "External frame" widget. After adding the widget, the System will display its parameters in the workspace.
For the subsequent adjustment of the widget, set the frame height and add an algorithm.
To add a new algorithm, click on the kebab menu in the right part of the field and select the "Add" option, which will open a modal window for creating a new algorithm, where you should specify the algorithm name and identifier.
The algorithm code contains a link to an external system placed in double quotes:
Next, save the algorithm with the
icon and click on the "OK" button. Also, save the visual by clicking on the "Save" / "OK" buttons on the "Elements" panel.
After that, the selected site will be displayed in the object profile.
If the borders allocated for the widget do not allow to fully display the site content, a vertical scroll bar is displayed on the right side of the frame, and a horizontal scroll bar on the bottom.
